creator: adelmelle@apache.org
text:
Considers a peculiarity I stumbled upon, while looking for clues on how to get column- or row-
span working in tables in 1.0dev ( still unsolved for the moment )

May not be much, but it seemed to me the kind of thing every performance tuning manual warns 
you about: why declare a new variable when you've already got one readily at your disposal?

If I'm missing something, consider just a cvs testcase ;)

Excellent.  These types of nitpicks, in their aggregate, are very helpful for 
speeding up FOP.  I'll take a look at it tomorrow, unless someone else grabs it 
by then.

Thanks,
Glen
creator: glenmazza@yahoo.com

text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
creator: gadams@apache.org
